metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4131 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mod_dav_svn Apache HTTPD server module in Subversion 1.7.0 through 1.7.10 and 1.8.x before 1.8.1 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (assertion failure or out-of-bounds read) via a certain (1) COPY, (2) DELETE, or (3) MOVE request against a revision root.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libapache2-svn - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-java - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-perl - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-ruby - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
libsvn1 - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
python-subversion - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
ruby-svn - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
subversion - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
subversion-tools - 1.7.13-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.13-2ubuntu2').
